questions.question: Part of the Recipe Unlimited Group along with The Keg and Swiss Chalet, this Canadian fast food franchise makes your hamburger a beautiful thing.
This KFC deal of the day in the early 2000's came with two pieces of chicken in a box of fries. Today, just the chicken runs $8.49 on their regular menu.
Despite it's name, this potato-based fast food chain only has locations across Canada and the Middle East - but they have none in the United States at all.
This Canadian fast food mascot would be accompanied by the tuba song 'Ba Dum Ba Dum' (heard here) in commercials from the 1970s through the late 90s.
questions.answer: Who is the Great Root Bear?

questions.question: This toy comes with a Medieval Meal in the film Shrek 2.
A fast food varient of Buzz Lightyear switches place with the familiar version in the Toy Story short film by this title.
After massive success of the first documentary in 2004, Supersize Me 2: Holy Chicken was released at this film festival in 2017.
questions.answer: What is the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF)?

questions.question: Exactly ten years after the first Clerks movie, Dante and Randal find themselves working at this fast food chain that was first featured in the movie Dogma.
This fast food tycoon is famously an advocate for adoption having been adopted himself.

This owner and manager of Pop's Chock'Lit Shoppe has sold many burgers to his favourite customer, Jughead Jones. His first name has been recorded as Terry, Bob, and Harold -- but the rest of his name has remained consistent.
This alias was chosen by a man found behind a Burger King in Richmond Hill, Georgia  in 2004. He is famous for his dissociative amnesia and was finally identified as William Burgess Powell in 2015.
In 2014, a McDonalds archivist went viral after claiming that the Grimace was one of two things: one was the embodiment of a shake. The other was this.
This viral trend highlights the unique archetecture of this fast food chain as new businesses occupy their former premises.
questions.answer: What is 'Used to be a Pizza Hut'?

questions.question: Today, this New Brunswick pizza chain spans Atlantic Canada and Ontario. It is remembered by locals for their toast and butter your own garlic bread.
Daily McDouble!
questions.answer: This claymation character was the mascot for Dominos in the 1980s. The campaign is often said to be discontinued after a gunman by the same surname took two Dominoes employees hostage in Atlanta, Georgia in 1989.

questions.question: The cocktails in this AI generated image are pizza homophones.
questions.answer: What is a Margharita and Little Caesar?
